summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message about breaking down the walls in our lives! Pastor Travis Hearn (PT) delivered an incredible sermon about overcoming obstacles using the incredible story of Joshua and the walls of Jericho. Drawing from Joshua chapter 6, PT reminds us that the walls that seem insurmountable are actually already defeated in God's perspective. Can you imagine standing before massive, fortified walls and being told to simply march around them and then shout? That's exactly what God instructed the Israelites to do! The sermon powerfully illustrates that our walls of shame, guilt, addiction, and fear are NOT more powerful than God's plan for our lives. PT passionately encourages us to walk by faith, not by sight, and to take bold steps even when things don't make sense. The most profound moment? When he declares that YOU are the giant, and your enemy is actually the grasshopper! This message isn't just about conquering physical walls, it's about stepping out of our comfort zones and trusting God's supernatural intervention in our lives.
mainPoints: Walk by faith, not by sight
Walk on God's word, not your worries

versesMentioned.text: Now Jericho was tightly shut because of the Israelites. No one went out and no one came in. Then the Lord said to Joshua, 'See, I have delivered Jericho into your hands, along with its king and its fighting men. March around the city once with all the armed men. Do this for six days. Have seven priests carry trumpets of rams' horns in front of the ark. On the seventh day, march around the city seven times, with the priests blowing the trumpets. When you hear them sound a long blast on the trumpets, have the whole army give a loud shout; then the wall of the city will collapse and the army will go up, everyone straight in.'
For we live by faith, not by sight.

When the woman saw that the fruit of the tree was good for food and pleasing to the eye, and also desirable for gaining wisdom, she took some and ate it. She also gave some to her husband, who was with her, and he ate it.
Risk your life and get more than you ever dreamed of. Play it safe and end up holding the bag.
However, as it is written: 'What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, and what no human mind has conceived' - the things God has prepared for those who love him

Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd. After he had dismissed them, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. Later that night, he was there alone, and the boat was already a considerable distance from land, buffeted by the waves because the wind was against it. Shortly before dawn he went out to them, walking on the lake. When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified. 'It's a ghost,' they said, and cried out in fear. But Jesus immediately said to them: 'Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid.' 'Lord, if it's you,' Peter replied, 'tell me to come to you on the water.' 'Come,' he said. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus. But when he saw the wind, he was afraid and, beginning to sink, cried out, 'Lord, save me!' Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. 'You of little faith,' he said, 'why did you doubt?'

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.'
Monday.focus: Identifying the walls blocking your progress
Monday.action: Take time to journal about the 'walls' in your life. What obstacles seem insurmountable? Write them down and pray over each one, declaring God's power over them.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the walls in my life that are holding me back. Give me the faith to see beyond what seems impossible and trust in Your supernatural power. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Tuesday.focus: Walking by faith, not by sight
Tuesday.action: Identify one area where you've been living in fear or comfort. Take a small, bold step of faith today, even if it feels uncomfortable.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me step out of my comfort zone and trust You completely. Give me courage to walk by faith and not by what I can see. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Wednesday.action: Make a list of areas where you've been trying to control the outcome. Physically write 'I surrender this to You, God' next to each item.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my plans and fears to You. Help me trust Your path, even when I can't see the entire journey. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Thursday.action: Reframe one current challenge as a potential opportunity for growth. How might God be working in this situation?
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me see my challenges through Your perspective. Reveal the purpose behind my current struggles and give me wisdom. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:7: 'For we live by faith, not by sight.'
Friday.action: Do something today that requires faith - start that project, have that conversation, make that commitment you've been avoiding.
Friday.prayer: God, give me the courage to step out in faith today. Help me trust You more than I trust my own understanding. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Joshua 1:9: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer, declaring God's promises over the walls in your life. Write down a faith declaration for each obstacle.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I declare Your power over every wall in my life. Give me strength, courage, and unwavering faith. I trust in Your promises. Amen.
